Lyrics: Como Santa María tolleu ũa gran tempestade de fógo en térra de Cecilla.
Direct Translation: How Holy Mary took away a great storm of fire in the land of Sicily.

Lyrics: Toller pód' a Madre de Nóstro Sennor
Direct Translation: The Mother of our Lord can take away
Poetic Translation: Mother of our Savior and Lord Who inspires,

Lyrics: toda tempestade, se ll' ên prazer for.
Direct Translation: all storms, if She so pleases.
Poetic Translation: She can make calm every storm if She desires.

Lyrics: E dest' en Cezilla mostrou ũa vez
Direct Translation: Concerning this, the Lady of Worth,
Poetic Translation: Concerning this truth, the Worthy Lady bright,

Lyrics: un mui gran miragre a Sennor de prez
Direct Translation: who is Mother and Daughter of that God
Poetic Translation: The Daughte rand Mother of our Lord of might

Lyrics: que é madr' e filla daquel Déus que fez
Direct Translation: who made the earth and put the heavens around it,
Poetic Translation: Who gave us the earth and filled the sky with light,

Lyrics: a térra e pos os céos en redor.
Direct Translation: once performed a very great miracle in Sicily.
Poetic Translation: In Sicily made a miracle transpire.

Lyrics: Cezilla é ũa ínssoa de mar
Direct Translation: Sicily is an island in the sea,
Poetic Translation: This Sicily is an island in the sea;

Lyrics: rica e viçosa, com' oí contar,
Direct Translation: rich and fertile, as I heard tell,
Poetic Translation: It's fertile and rich, or so they say to me,

Lyrics: de toda-las cousas que pód' óm' achar
Direct Translation: in all the things that man my find
Poetic Translation: Abundant in everything it takes to be

Lyrics: por aver avondo e viç' e sabor.
Direct Translation: to enjoy abundance and well-being and pleasure.
Poetic Translation: Contented and healthy: all that man requires.

Lyrics: En aquesta térra un mui gran mont' á
Direct Translation: In this land there is a very large mountain
Poetic Translation: In Sicily stands a mountain tall and gray,

Lyrics: que veen de longe os que van alá,
Direct Translation: which those who go there can see from afar.
Poetic Translation: Whose pinnacle can be seen from far away.

Lyrics: que Mongibél chaman, e de fógos dá
Direct Translation: It is called Mongibello*, and it gives off
Poetic Translation: They title it Mongibello and they pray,

Lyrics: chamas aas vezes, ond' an gran pavor
Direct Translation: bursts of fire someimes, of which
Poetic Translation: For sometimes it bursts with unexpected fires.

Lyrics: Todo-los da térra. Onde conteceu
Direct Translation: all those of the land have great terror. It happened
Poetic Translation: It happened that once a burning very great

Lyrics: que en aquel monte fógo s' acendeu
Direct Translation: that a very great fire began to burn in the mountain,
Poetic Translation: Began in the mountain and did not abate.

Lyrics: mui grande, e toda a térra tremeu,
Direct Translation: and all the earth trembled,
Poetic Translation: A tremble went through the earth and pitched its weight,

Lyrics: e choveu tan muito come no maior
Direct Translation: and it rained as much as in the most severe
Poetic Translation: And winter rain fell, though winter had expired.

Lyrics: Invérno do mundo chóve, com' oí,
Direct Translation: winter in the world, as I heard,
Poetic Translation: And mixed with the rain was hail without reprieve

Lyrics: vólta con gran pédra, e ar outrossí
Direct Translation: mixed with hail, and also
Poetic Translation: And more bolts of lightning than you can conceive.

Lyrics: caían coriscos tantos ben alí
Direct Translation: so many bolts of lightning struck there
Poetic Translation: And Sicily's people thought they would receive

Lyrics: que cuidaron todos morrer a door.
Direct Translation: that all thought to die a painful death.
Poetic Translation: Their arduous deaths on unexpected pyres.

Lyrics: Quaraenta días aquesto durou
Direct Translation: This lasted forty days
Poetic Translation: This lasted for forty days and forty nights

Lyrics: e quarenta noites, que nunca quedou
Direct Translation: and forty nights and never ceased
Poetic Translation: And did not desist in darknes sor in light

Lyrics: atá que Santa María se mostrou
Direct Translation: until Holy Mary appeared
Poetic Translation: Until Holy Mary came in splendor bright

Lyrics: a ũu bon óme con gran resprandor.
Direct Translation: in great splendor to a good man.
Poetic Translation: To speak with a man whose goodness was admired.

Lyrics: E disse-ll' a Reínna esperital:
Direct Translation: The Spiritual Queen said to him:
Poetic Translation: The Spiritual Queen commanded unto him,

Lyrics: Se tu quéres que se tólla este mal,
Direct Translation: "If you wish this affliction to be taken away,
Poetic Translation: "To cease this affliction, desolate and grim,

Lyrics: un cantar me façan que seja atal
Direct Translation: let them compose a song for me,
Poetic Translation: Put ink in your pen; compose for me a hymn

Lyrics: qual a mi convên, ben feit' a mia loor.
Direct Translation: fitting and well made, in my praise."
Poetic Translation: That's fitting to praise me with your finest choirs."

Lyrics: O óme bõo, que aquesto veer
Direct Translation: The good man, who saw this
Poetic Translation: The man, who was thrilled by all he saw and heard,

Lyrics: foi en visôn, muito ouve gran prazer;
Direct Translation: in a vision, was greatly pleased by it.
Poetic Translation: Began to compose the song as She preferred,

Lyrics: des i começou séu cantar a fazer
Direct Translation: Immediately he began to compose his song,
Poetic Translation: With careful attention paid to every word

Lyrics: rimado segundo el soube mellor.
Direct Translation: rhymed as best he knew how.
Poetic Translation: And excellent rhymes, which such a hymn requires.

Lyrics: E segund' as paravlas lle fez o son,
Direct Translation: In keeping with the words, he set it to music
Poetic Translation: To strengthen the words, the tune had perfect form;

Lyrics: e depois cantó-o con gran devoçôn;
Direct Translation: and then sang it with great devotion.
Poetic Translation: He sang in devotion, reverent and warm.

Lyrics: e a tempestade quedou lógu' entôn,
Direct Translation: The storm quieted at once,
Poetic Translation: And as it was sounded, quiet grew the storm,

Lyrics: e perdeu ên lógo a gente temor.
Direct Translation: and the people lost their fear of it.
Poetic Translation: To frighten no more with burning hail and fires.

Lyrics: Alfonso X el Sabio, King of Castile and León
Direct Translation: Alfonso. Songs of Holy Mary of Alfonso X, the Wise: A Translation of the Cantigas de Santa Maria. Trans. Kathleen Kulp-Hill. Tempe, AZ: Arizona Center for Medieval and Renaissance Studies, 2000. Print.
